question: 3 (b)
statement_html: Determine if \(\displaystyle 2821 = 7 \cdot 13 \cdot 31\) is a Carmichael number. Explain your answer. (Recall that a Carmichael number is a compositive integer n such that \(\displaystyle a^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}\) whenever \(\displaystyle (a,n) = 1\).)
statement_latex:
Determine if $\displaystyle 2821 = 7 \cdot 13 \cdot 31$ is a Carmichael
number. Explain your answer. (Recall that a Carmichael number is a
compositive integer \emph{n} such that
$\displaystyle a^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}$ whenever
$\displaystyle (a,n) = 1$.)
statement_raw: Determine if <math> \displaystyle 2821 = 7 \cdot 13 \cdot 31</math> is a Carmichael number. Explain your answer. (Recall that a Carmichael number is a compositive integer ''n'' such that <math> \displaystyle a^{n-1} \equiv 1 \mod{n}</math> whenever <math> \displaystyle (a,n) = 1</math>.)
